thread.title: Noel in on 2 scores, Sacred Heart forces 8 turnovers to beat Robert Morris 26-13
thread.title_full: Noel in on 2 scores, Sacred Heart forces 8 turnovers to beat Robert Morris 26-13

title: Noel in on 2 scores, Sacred Heart forces 8 turnovers to beat Robert Morris 26-13
text:
Noel in on 2 scores, Sacred Heart forces 8 turnovers to beat Robert Morris 26-13 THE ASSOCIATED PRESS  37  37   
Subjects: Football (1913) 
MOON TOWNSHIP, Pennsylvania — R.J. Noel passed for one touchdown and ran for another, and Sacred Heart's defense forced eight turnovers to defeat Robert Morris 26-13 on Saturday. 
The Pioneers (3-2, 1-0), with the Northeast Conference's top rush defense, held Robert Morris (2-4, 1-1), the Northeast's second-leading rushing team, to minus-7 yards on the ground. Sacred Heart forced three Robert Morris players into seven fumbles and recovered four. The Pioneers also picked off Colonials quarterback Luke Brumbaugh three times. 
Noel, who completed 21 of 40 for 222 yards, hit Jalyn Croom with a 36-yard strike to open the scoring. Ose Imeokparia and Noel scored on runs of 1 and 6 yards, and Alec Finney added two field goals. 
Neither Robert Morris TD came from its offense: Jimmy Masson intercepted Noel and returned it 49 yards to bring Robert Morris to 14-7 and Dante Satcher returned a kickoff 96 yards for a touchdown.
